> It seems to me that the latest and greatest technology being
> experimented with here is Junit 4, not Java 5. To use Java 5 for running
> Junit it would not need to be "installed" by sysadmins anymore than you
> need a sysadmin to install junit 4. You just need a JRE somewhere. It
> could even be in source control (assuming that's allowed by the license).


Here's our business problem. Our server products only dropped support for
Java 1.3 six months ago. Our Build Services people will only allow JRE's
that are used in our production environment on their machines. I could argue
until I was blue in the face and it would make no difference. So instead I'm
here trying to get Kent's attention and demonstrate the need for a back port
to JUnit 4.xx.

Kent where are you? Do you have any thoughts on a back port of JUnit 4.1 to
Java 1.4?

Cheers
Mark Levison
